clues.text: In 1967 Klaus Voormann won one of these for his design of The Beatles "Revolver" album cover
Kevin McCarthy won a Golden Globe for Promising Male Newcomer for playing Biff Loman in this 1951 movie
This award named for John Chapman is given to those who pioneered in some branch of horticulture
Husband & wife in real life, they won Emmys in 1986 for playing husband & wife on "St. Elsewhere"
The Prince of Wales, Lady Byng & Conn Smythe trophies are awarded in this professional sport
"Lady Boss" continues her story of "Lucky"
During WWII this author of "Slaughterhouse Five" was a prisoner of war in Germany
In 1990 actress Kathryn Leigh Scott published her 2nd book on this gothic soap & NBC revived the show in 1991
The L.A. Times reports many of this author's fans have named their kids Ayla after her heroine
The title of the Franz Kafka story "Die Verwandlung" changed into this in English
The Palk Strait & Gulf of Mannar separate India from this island nation
The French department of Saint Pierre & Miquelon is just south of this Canadian province
The longest river in Southeast Asia, it rises in Tibet & empties into the South China Sea in Vietnam
Until 1940, Lake Ladoga near Leningrad was part of the border between the USSR & this country
Once called Basutoland, this kingdom is completely surrounded by South Africa
Ci which stands for Curie, is a unit used to measure this
It's the acid that makes lemons & limes sour
In the Haber process hydrogen & nitrogen combine to form this pungent gas
The relationship between heat, work & energy is the basis of this physics branch
To convert Fahrenheit to Celsius subtract 32 & multiply by this fraction
From 1963 to 1986 this golfer won a record 6 Masters tournaments
She won both the Golden Ball as top player & the Golden Boot as top scorer of the 2019 Women's World Cup
A 4-man team called Wild Card 1 swept to victory at the 2022 Tim Hortons Brier, Canada's championship of this
This event began in 1993 as a multi-match tournament, with jiu jitsu master Royce Gracie winning the first 2 titles
The U. of Denver won the 2022 NCAA men's hockey championship alliteratively called this, ahead of Minnesota State, Minnesota & Michigan
This name for a huge flat region of plains in Argentina is also used for a stretch of desert in Chile
In March 1736 Charles-Marie de la Condamine landed in what's now this country to determine the Earth's shape & circumference
This huge body of water by Venezuela's northwest coast is called an estuarine lake, as it mingles with the Caribbean
Nieuw Nickerie & Lelydorp are among the largest cities in this country
Thousands of years old, large geoglyphs representing plants & animals can be seen 15 miles northwest of this Peruvian city

a class of spirits in Muslim demonology

a clove hitch

newspaper slang following "nut"
The Battles of Queenston Heights & Lake Erie were both fought during this war
Post-WWII British Foreign Secretary Ernest Bevin said this Secretary of State threw "a lifeline to sinking men"
In the 18th century the Apache lost dominance to this other people whose name ends with the same 3 letters
Giovanni Cornaro II, Doge of Venice until 1722, was the last one to rule over the Morea, an old name for this Greek peninsula

Faster Anglican priest who scores field goals

clues.text: A dealer working on commission selling yellowish, tight-fitting necklaces
Forgotify is a place to hear songs that had never been listened to on this other service
theredshtick.com gives humorous takes on the goings-on in this Southern state capital & its environs
This website named for a family in Faulkner books debunks false claims & checks facts on all sorts of subjects

NASA's Astronomy
Picture of the Day revealed that this largest moon of Mars may eventually disintegrate; scary indeed
radio.garden lets you sample radio stations from around the world, like Radio Carnaval Tenerife in this island chain

clues.text: Weird: Charlotte Bronte provided the first known use of this alliterative 2-word term for a lawless section of American frontier
The first line of "The Canterbury Tales" is quoted under the entry for this month
You'll find this 1719 work quoted under "goatskin", "rescue" & "wreck"
Works by her are quoted under "cup of tea", "grey cells" & "motive"
The entry for "she" cites "'She-who-must-be-obeyed' commands thy presence" from a work by this adventure novelist
Christopher Columbus lands on an island in the Caribbean & names it San Salvador
The Manhattan Project begins
After capturing New Orleans, David Farragut is given the new rank of rear admiral
Ulysses Grant is reelected president
More than a quarter of English colonists in Virginia are killed in a massacre; John Rolfe also dies

rounds.text: It was originally a code word used by telegraph operators; Barack Obama used it in his Twitter handle
